user_auth.forms module

class user_auth.forms.NewUserForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: UserCreationForm

Class providing the form for a new user to register.

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

Class representing the fields that need to be completed to register initially.

param str first_name:

This name is use to Welcome the user when logged in

param str username:

This is the name that will be used to log in in the future

param str password1:

The password that the user would like to use to log in in the future

param str password2:

The password to confirm that the user correctly entered the password the first time

fields = ('first_name', 'username', 'password1', 'password2')
model

alias of User

base_fields = {'first_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password1': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'username': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}

save(commit=True)[source]

Save the new user details and make sure that the user is not registered as a super user.

user_auth.urls module

user_auth.views module

user_auth.views.authorize_user(request)[source]

Confirms that the user has been registered before and is authorized to log in.

user_auth.views.login_user(request)[source]

Calls the html page to allow the user to log in.

user_auth.views.logout_user(request)[source]

Calls the function to log the user out and redirect them to the home page (index.html).

user_auth.views.register_user(request)[source]

Allows the user to register if they have not registered before.

If the credentials are valid, a Registration successful message will be logged and the user will be redirected to the home page.

If the credentials are not valid, an Unsuccessful message will be displayed at the bottom of the screen and the user will be allowed to re-enter their credentials.
